nileFlood.name: Nile Flood Variability
nileFlood.description: Nile flood levels varied significantly, affecting grain production in Egypt. Low floods led to famine; high floods could damage infrastructure. Critical for grain supply to Athens.
nileFlood.impact: Direct correlation with grain yields in Egypt (Manning 2018)

methanaVolcano.name: Methana Volcano
methanaVolcano.description: Thucydides 3.89-90: Volcanic activity at Methana c. 425 BCE. Localized impact on weather and agriculture. Ash fall could affect crops and shipping visibility.
methanaVolcano.source: Thucydides, History of the Peloponnesian War 3.89-90
methanaVolcano.impact: Localized weather disruption, ash fall on crops

okmokVolcano.name: Okmok Volcanic Aerosol (43 BCE)
okmokVolcano.description: Okmok eruption in 43 BCE caused global volcanic aerosol effects. Reduced solar radiation led to cooler temperatures, crop failures, and grain shortages across the Mediterranean.
okmokVolcano.impact: Global climate cooling, reduced crop yields, grain price spikes

etesianWinds.name: Etesian Winds
etesianWinds.description: Seasonal northerly winds (July-September) blowing across the Aegean. Critical for grain shipping from Egypt and the Black Sea to Athens. Winds facilitate northward sailing but can hinder southward routes.
etesianWinds.impact: Determines optimal shipping windows for grain transport (Horden & Purcell 2000)
